str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To look with favor on, regard. From epi and blepo; to gaze at.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: To carry, wear, bear constantly. From phoros; to have a burden, i.e. to wear as clothing or a constant accompaniment.
From the same as lampas; radiant; by analogy, limpid; figuratively, magnificent or sumptuous.
Clothing, raiment, vestment, robe. From hennumi; dress.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.
From an adverb form of hode; in this same spot, i.e. Here or hither.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Middle or Passive - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To sit, be seated, enthroned; I dwell, reside. From kata; and hemai; to sit down; figuratively, to remain, reside.
Well, nobly, honorably, rightly. Adverb from kalos; well.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Poor, destitute, spiritually poor, either in a good sense (humble devout persons) or bad.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: A prolonged form of a primary stao stah'-o; to stand, used in various applications.
Or, than. A primary particle of distinction between two connected terms; disjunctive, or; comparative, than.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Middle or Passive - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To sit, be seated, enthroned; I dwell, reside. From kata; and hemai; to sit down; figuratively, to remain, reside.
A primary preposition; under, i.e. of place, or with verbs; of place (underneath) or where (below) or time (when).

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
A footstool. Neuter of a compound of hupo and pous; something under the feet, i.e. A foot-rest.
